topics.author: 5154c5237f123bcd580002fc

topics.body:
"@Randomosaur":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/539bb15c63687276e7a00100#post_539bb15c63687276e7a00100
Because making a character who is dark and evil is a delicate thing that requires a degree of nuance and restraint that young amateurs rarely demonstrate. It requires a certain amount of self awareness to know when you are making an actual character instead of a self insert/wish fulfillment character. 

There is also a degree of over saturation to consider. Every teenager/young adult makes themselves a dark and gritty character it seems like. I did, and I am properly ashamed.

I'd like you to meet Hex:
!http://th00.deviantart.net/fs5/PRE/i/2005/130/3/c/Wall_of_Murder_by_gasmaskangel.jpg!

This is an OC of mine from way back in 2005 (I was 16 at the time). Fucking look at his ass. Long hair, different colored eyes, gothy as fucking fuck outfit. I was badly enamored of Johnny The Homicidal Maniac at the time, as well as Hellsing. He was *dark* and *tormented*. Pretty much the only part of this character I'm proud of was that his mandatory ridiculously OP superpowers (which all such OCs have) was pure body horror, albeit in a stupidly dark and gothy way.

!http://fc09.deviantart.net/fs9/i/2006/047/3/8/angel_of_darkness_by_gasmaskangel.jpg!
topics.author: 4f41ee04945b701c41002af7
